Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects that collectively make up the geometry of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Except as noted, members of this class behave exactly as described by the , , and documentation. **Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the class, the class provides several special features: objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md). ## XAML Implicit Collection Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Attribute Usage ```

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> objects derive from <xref:System.Windows.Freezable>, they are copied when they are used. Therefore, later, you might not be able to retrieve or remove the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> you added to the collection using the original <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> object. The <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> in the collection is a copy of the original <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> and is considered a different <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> than the one you added.
This implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to add a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Windows.Media.PathFigure value) cil managed

Docs.param: The to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Searches for the specified and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.
Docs.returns: The index of if found in the ; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection is searched forward starting at the first <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> and ending at the last <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure>.
This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigureCollection.Count%2A>. That is, this method is an O(*n*) operation, where *n* is equal to <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigureCollection.Count%2A>.
